description.narrative: The development objective of Housing Finance Project is to increase access to housing finance for households, and support capital market development in Pakistan. This project has three components. 1) The first component, Supporting Pakistan Mortgage Refinance Company (PMRC) in Strengthening its Capital Base, aims to help strengthen PMRC's capital base so it can operate on a sustainable basis and become a highly rated bond issuer in Pakistan. 2) The second component, Supporting the Expansion of Mortgage Loans, aims to provide incentives for Primary Mortgage Lender (PMLs) to increase access to mortgage loans to a larger segment of the population. It has the following subcomponents: (a) Line of Credit; and (b) Risk‐Sharing Facility. 3) The third component, Capacity Building for Housing Policy and Analytics, aims to enhance analytical capacity and policy formulation for sound national housing policy and for addressing supply‐side constraints that hamper the development of affordable housing stock in Pakistan.

condition.narrative: Financing Agreement - Section I. Implementation Arrangements.The Recipient, through its Planning Commission, shall adopt and causePMRC to adopt the Project Operations Manual, acceptable to the Association, within two (2) months from the Effective Date.

Financing Agreement - Section II. Project Monitoring, Reporting and Evaluation Reporting.The Recipient shall furnish to theAssociation each Project Report not later than forty-five (45) days after the end of each calendar semester, covering the calendarsemester.

Financing Agreement - Section IV. Other Undertakings.The Recipient shall refund the proceeds of the Credit allocated for carryingout of Part 1 of the Project, if PMRC falls into bankruptcy proceedings and/or its capital is seized or otherwise depleted fornon-Project purposes, prior to the Closing Date.

Project Agreement with PMRC - Part 2 (a) of the Project.PMRC shall hire a risk manager and an internal auditor, whose terms ofreference are acceptable to the Association, within three (3) months from the Effective Date.
